items.sentence: Tom had lots of run-ins with the law when he was a teenager.
I think that our living together has influenced your habits.
I know that this is the first time this has happened to you.
I had my car filled up at the service station at the corner.
You'll be better off buying a new one than trying to fix it.
Now that you've finished your work, you are free to go home.
I should've tried out this electric shaver before buying it.
Remember that time when Tom threw up on that roller coaster?
Why on earth did you think that Tom would know how to drive?
The boy thought he'd better say nothing more on the subject.
Tom will make fewer mistakes once he gets to know the ropes.
Tom was still wearing his pajamas when he answered the door.
Tom is, without doubt, the best French speaker in our class.
Tom is still trying to convince Mary not to do that anymore.
I think that Tom and Mary have been married for three years.
Tom and Mary were silent for a moment, sipping their coffee.
Would it be OK if I told Tom that he didn't need to help us?
Tom told me that he had three hundred dollars in his wallet.
Tom told me that he planned to wait until Monday to do that.
Tom told me that he wanted to buy a new battery for his car.
